item.title: Glimpses in Computer Vision
item.description: Glimpses in Computer Vision (In Progress) This essay outlines some major developments in the field of computer vision, starting from Perceptron up to more recent developments like EfficientNet. Perceptron (1957) Our journey will start in the late 50s. In 1957 Rosenblatt, an erudite psychologist, conceived of Perceptron, the earliest and simplest type of artificial neural network. Its functionality is straightforward: given a set of inputs and based on some calculations it outputs 0 or 1.
